nodes.bodyText: Should we update this file, across multiple plugin runs, in case the project config has changed in between? Either way, is it warranted to log an Info for this condition?

I don't think we want to run it each time. Since this runs amplify-app, it could conceivably clobber other state. I'm also slightly skeptical on logging as I think this will be noise as first time users won't encounter this state. I think!
Maybe we should say that npx was not found instead since node could be installed without npx
Hm, I don't agree, because most Android developers don't know what npx is. We have a better shot if we say node.js at comprehension.
Does npx come bundled with node? I thought my laptop had been in a state at one point where I had node, but not npx?

npx comes bundled with npm (after version 5.something), which comes bundled with node. In Node 10+, all users who have node installed should also have npx installed. I tested this on a new system with Windows, installed Node 12 installed, and have npx available.
